Feywild.name: Feywild
description: The @+Feywild+@ is an inner plane of the universal cosmology. Much like the Shadowfell, it is a reflection of the Prime Material plane, specifically of the natural world, and it is not uncommon to find locations where to the two planes cross into each other, allowing peoples to travel between the two realms. The Feywild is the manifestation of mortal emotions, specifically dream, imagination and faith.

Land of Four Seasons: The Feywild is a supernatural reflection of the natural world, mimicking the prime material plane, but creating an exaggerated, wondrous reflection of Centhris.

The plane is divided between the four realms, each representing an aspect of the natural cycle of seasons. Each realm is ruled by powerful beings, known as Archfey, who rule over their domain not through force like the rulers of Centhris, but almost as a natural extension of the Feywild itself.

The Realm of Spring is the land of rebirth. It is a colorful, vibrant region which is eternally in full bloom, as a natural representation of the cycle beginning anew. The Spring Realm is the realm of joy and mirth. Those who reside in this realm delight in all aspects of nature. This region is where the Eladrin that would become the Cúron'avar hailed from.
The Realm of Spring is ruled over by the Council of the Blooming Vale, led by the Lord of the Green, and his courtiers, the Minstrel, the Good Fellow and the Lady of Blossoms.

The Realm of Summer is a supernatural representation of the glory of nature and the bounty it provides. It is a bright, energetic region which towering trees and plentiful resources. This is the realm from which the Eladrin that would become the Glân'avar hail. In this realm and it's glorious, endless wonder, reside haughty entities who exemplify the proud, refined visage of nature.
The Realm of Summer is ruled by the Bonfire Court, led by the illustrious Summer Queen, and her courtiers, the Silver Blade, the Prince of Harts, and the Lady of the Wood.

The Realm of Autumn is a place of endless change and instability, drifting from the glory of summer into the sorrow of winter. The beings of this realm stand as a supernatural representation of the fear of aging,  and the inevitability of change. It is from this realm that the eladrin of the autumn entered the Prime Materium and slowly became the elves known as the Galenâs'avar.

The Realm of Autumn is the realm of fear and dread, ruled by the Court of Colors, led by the enigmatic Oracle of Fates, and her courtiers, the Thornweaver, the Dream Walker and the Mistress of the Hunt.

The Realm of Winter is a dark, frozen land. It is the home realm of the Aeglôs'avar and a land of endless sorrow and longing. Any beings who reside here, or unwisely visit for too long are slowly drained of any sense of humor, cheer or comfort. As such, the denizens of this realm seek to gain this lost sense of joy by taking it from other beings, either through force or trickery. An endless sense of dread and looming malice haunt this land, as all who reside here seek to break free of its continual torment.
The Realm of Winter is ruled by the Court of Twilight, led by the dreaded Lord of Frost, and his courtiers, the Lady in the Water and the Winter Witch.

Beings of Aether: Unlike the beings of the natural realm, who are born of the earth and clay, those of the Feywild are comprised of a more fantastic essence, representing their unnatural presence. All beings born of the Feywild are comprised of aether, the fifth element.

Shadowfell.name: Shadowfell
description: The @+Shadowfell+@ is an inner plane of the universal cosmology, sometimes referred to as the Negative Plane. Much like the Feywild, it is a reflection of the Prime Material plan and it is not uncommon to find locations where to the two planes cross into each other, allowing peoples to travel between the two realms. The Shadowfell reflects the dark, hidden or negative aspects of the mortal world. Few enter this place by choice, as they quickly discover it is a realm of paranoia, misery and dread.

The Shadowfell is a reflection of the mortal world, though not always in an expected way. Where on Centhris a keep stands, in the Shadowfell you might find a shattered ruin or a grand, dark tower. A verdant forest might reflect as a vast, nightmarish wood filled with vicious, savage predators, or a long-dead forest of ruined trees.

The plane is ruled over by the dangerous and capricious Lords of the Fell, sometimes referred to as Aspects. The exact nature of these beings is unknown, as they seem to exhibit almost god-like power in their own domain, but are completely unable to affect areas outside it. These places of power, of which each lords controls only one, are personal domains where they have absolute power. These dark masters almost never interact with each other, as they are essentially unable to leave their own domains; the exception to this seems to be the city of Gloomwrought, where all the denizens of the Shadowfell may tread. It is extremely rare to see a fell lord in @~Gloomwrought~@, even if they are able to travel to it, since they are at their weakest when in the City of Shadow. Only the most important or enticing scenarios manage to attract a dark master to the city.

Astra-Sea.name: Astra Sea
Astra-Sea.quote: "It is the space between everything. It is the road that goes everywhere. It is where you are when you aren't anywhere else."
description: The @+Astra Sea+@ is an outer plane in universal cosmology and the domain of raw elemental energy and matter. It is considered the opposite of its elemental counterpart, the Elemental Chaos. It is described as being "above" the Prime Material plane and its reflections, the Feywild and the Shadowfell.

Time in the Astral flows at the same rate as on a Prime Material plane but the effects of time are slowed almost to a stop ― a thousand years in the Astral plane feels like only a day to its denizens. Creatures do not go hungry, nor do they age while in the Astral plane. For that reason, its mortal inhabitants need to return to the Material Plane in order to have children, or to reach adulthood.

Elemental-Chaos.name: Elemental Chaos
description: The @+Elemental Chaos+@ is an outer plane in universal cosmology and the domain of raw elemental energy and matter. It is considered the opposite of its divine counterpart, the Astral Sea. The Elemental Chaos is home to the four primary elemental planes,  the Plane of Air, the Plane of Earth, the Plane of Fire, and the Plane of Water, as well as most planes cosmically aligned with Chaos. The Abyss is located at the bottom of the Elemental Chaos, below the realm of Pandemonium.

Celestia.name: Celestia
description: @+Celestia+@ is the plane of divine benevolence dedicated to goodness, shaped by law and justice tempered with mercy. The plane is located in the Astral Sea.

Mechanus.name: Mechanus
description: @+Mechanus+@ is the plane of divine law and cosmic order located in the Astral Sea. Mechanus is said to be comprised of an infinite number of interlocking, gear-like discs. As the plane of absolute law and order, Mechanus has perfectly equal amounts of light and dark, and equal measure of the four elements. There is a place for everything on the plane. Even individuals living here exist to fit into the greater scheme of things and thus achieve a perfect society.

Nine-Hells.name: Nine Hells
description: The @+Nine Hells+@ is a plane of sinister evil and institutional cruelty located in the Astral Sea. The hells are organized into nine different infinite layers which are connected via barriers. Thus the lowest point of one layer manifests as the highest point of the one below it. It is definitely the home of all cosmic Lawful Evil and is ruled by the Master.

Pandemonium.name: Pandemonium
description: @+Pandemonium+@ is a plane of discord and entropy located in the Elemental Chaos.

Vorganund.name: Vorganund
description: @+Vorganund+@ is a plane of evil and malice located in the Astral Sea. The beings of this plane take no sides in the eternal conflict between order and chaos, interfering only when they see a situation that might be profitable or a potential for the advancement of their own schemes.

Abyss.name: Abyss
description: The @+Abyss+@ is the infinitely deep, endlessly shifting pit which is the home of all demons. The plane is located at the bottom of the Elemental Chaos.

Elysium.name: Elysium
description: The plane of @+Elysium+@ is the .

Arcadia.name: Arcadia
description: @+Arcadia+@ is the plane of unfettered freedom and benevolence, located in the Astral Sea. The plane is renowned for its natural beauty with a multitude of thriving environments. Much of the plane is dominated by vast tall forests, but also includes glades of wildflowers and fields of grain. As a plane that embodies chaos, it has a wild and often sudden nature, with great storms arising without notice.

Elysium.name: Elysium
description: The plane of @+Elysium+@ is the .

Plane-of-Fire.name: Plane of Fire
description: The @+Elemental Plane of Fire+@ is one of the planes of the Elemental Chaos. It is the home plane for all fire elementals and the location of the City of Brass.

Plane-of-Air.name: Plane of Air
description: The @+Elemental Plane of Air+@ is one of the planes of the Elemental Chaos. The plane is a vast, open void of swirling wind, clouds and floating chunks of earth which move in the air currents.

Plane-of-Water.name: Plane of Water
description: The @+Elemental Plane of Water+@ is one of the planes of the Elemental Chaos. The plane is comprised of a endless ocean filled with all manner of sea life.

Plane-of-Earth.name: Plane of Earth
description: The @+Elemental Plane of Earth+@ is one of the planes of the Elemental Chaos. A seemingly endless series of caverns, cliffs and gorges, this plane is home plane for all earth elementals.
